intro: Oldenlandia dimorpha, commonly known as the velvetleaf or spiderling plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its rapid growth and invasive tendencies make it a notable species in ecological studies.
